page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: We went to Basildon Railway Station. The Station Manager was called Mr. Turner. He told us that three to four thousand passengers travel through the station each day. Basildon Station is a large building with a Booking Office selling tickets and a shop selling newspapers, magazines and sweets. There is a lift and a staircase up to the platform. On the patform There is a waiting room. There are two railway tracks, one leading to London, the other leading to Southend-on-Sea. The trains are blue and white. They are electric trains with overhead wires. The fronts and the backs of the trains are painted bright yellow. The guard was a lady. She had a whistle to send the trains on their way. She had a special key to lock the carriage doors.
